channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: CDC advisers unanimously recommended Covid vaccines for children under 5, the last group of Americans to qualify for the shots. If the agency’s director endorses the move, immunizations could start Tuesday. https://t.co/byCDIEE0ZY

Cryptocurrency prices are plummeting and investors have been plunged into financial ruin.
Now, concern is mounting over another potential vulnerability in the market: Tether, a company whose namesake currency is a linchpin of crypto trading worldwide. https://t.co/xA6S0R72s7

If the Justice Department brings a case against Donald Trump, prosecutors face the challenge of showing he knew — or should have known — that assertions about election fraud were false, or that his attempt to block congressional certification was illegal. https://t.co/e02Y9nnCZv
Breaking news: Bitcoin plummeted below $20,000 for the first time since November 2020, driven partly by the recent collapse of two big cryptocurrency projects. https://t.co/IBiEUDgFUo

The European Commission recommended on Friday that Ukraine be granted candidate status in the country’s bid to become a member of the EU. It also recommended a similar status for Moldova, but it declined to recommend candidacy for neighboring Georgia. https://t.co/urFFq589Z1 https://t.co/I6lnZrZJRK

Gun companies are refocusing their message away from hunting and toward personal safety, including the sale of military-style weapons attractive to mostly young men. Their pitch — rooted in self-defense, machismo and fear — has been remarkably successful. https://t.co/Nf8KlJQgdz https://t.co/zO2BtRnaeh

President Volodymyr Zelensky made an unannounced visit Saturday to Mykolaiv, a Ukrainian city battered by the war that has been held up by Kyiv as a sign of fierce resistance. He visited a hospital and said the staff who saved lives were "heroic people." https://t.co/jkiQ5eFKdf https://t.co/heSBHsaMMj

In Opinion
"While the committee is rightly seeking testimony from Ginni Thomas, Democrats should say something too. They shouldn’t just say something, they should scream something," writes Jamelle Bouie. https://t.co/n1pVncENRK

Mark Shields, a fixture in American political journalism and punditry who was seen on "PBS NewsHour" for 33 years, died on Saturday at his home in Maryland. He was 85. https://t.co/9xvRiAGTiv https://t.co/6dGGMSEOPX

"Plan 75," the new film from Japanese director Chie Hayakawa, has a shocking premise about a government push to euthanize the elderly. It takes on one of Japan's biggest elephants in the room: the challenges of dealing with the world’s oldest society. https://t.co/u10PiJAJsm https://t.co/fhzTMuI6ip

In a nation at war, and a city aching for some semblance of normality, the Odesa Opera reopened on Friday for the first time since the Russian invasion began. The performance began with an impassioned rendering of the Ukrainian national anthem. https://t.co/kaiMsj4FrD https://t.co/kP9AddELQI

In a new series exploring the world through books, Leïla Slimani, a winner of France’s Goncourt Prize, describes Paris and recommends books that reveal hidden facets of the city.
Read more: https://t.co/dzPSJ3JY0j https://t.co/uofnNXY1xI

U.S. Capitol Police arrested a production team for "The Late Show With Stephen Colbert" who were filming a segment that featured Triumph the Insult Comic Dog, and charged them with unlawful entry. https://t.co/OiGBzbhKkT

Representative Bennie Thompson, chairman of the Jan. 6 committee, has spent his career fighting to protect the right to vote. He said the committee’s work was among the most important he had engaged in as a politician. https://t.co/00t3n8M621
Human urine is full of the same nutrients that plants need to flourish. During a worldwide fertilizer shortage, that's come in handy. https://t.co/ujPzc28b4D

For her role in the new movie "Good Luck to You, Leo Grande," Emma Thompson made the choice to disrobe. It was the most difficult thing she's done in her four-decade career, she says. https://t.co/qr7MWbZ7fK https://t.co/Berl0VwIWc

A man who threatened Colorado’s secretary of state on Instagram last year faces up to two years in prison. The Nebraska man was the first convicted by a Justice Department task force combatting the intimidation of election officials. https://t.co/TnU9ayUvN6

Dorothy Smith, a feminist scholar and sociologist whose criticism of her own field led her to establish groundbreaking theories that pushed sociology away from its foundations as a male-dominated endeavor, died on June 3. She was 95. https://t.co/Z7NH9SFHo3

What started out as a relaxing potluck dinner at an Episcopal church in Alabama on Thursday evening took a sudden and deadly turn when a man pulled out a handgun and opened fire, killing three people, the authorities said. https://t.co/VCftAVwv1c https://t.co/vR8djgqQSo

President Vladimir Putin lashed out at the U.S. on Friday, calling it a fading power that treats its allies as colonies. In a speech at an economic forum, he said sanctions on Russia, not the Ukraine war, are hurting Western economies. https://t.co/EJJBiTSqLf

In Opinion
"While the committee is rightly seeking testimony from Ginni Thomas, Democrats should say something too. They shouldn’t just say something, they should scream something," writes Jamelle Bouie. https://t.co/hI6GzkuQbs

His money doesn’t jiggle jiggle, and he doesn’t want to be a rapper.
Louis Theroux’s unlikely TikTok hit shows “the weirdness of the world that we live in,” the British American journalist said. https://t.co/xkLPv7oY7g https://t.co/nQtLdL3yVl

Donald Trump continued pressuring Mike Pence to overturn his election defeat even after he was told it was illegal, according to testimony laid out in extensive detail by the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack. https://t.co/mDTxz3o2bu https://t.co/49iLNM8E89

Representative Bennie Thompson, chairman of the committee investigating the Capitol attack, said he was disturbed by the gallows protesters brought for Vice President Mike Pence on Jan. 6 — and by the Confederate flags in the crowd. Read our profile. https://t.co/3fSiRF49Qq https://t.co/dIHLAouM4c

A North Carolina charter school violated female students’ constitutional rights by requiring that they wear skirts, a court ruled.
The decision said the dress code communicated “that girls are ‘fragile’” and “require protection by boys.” https://t.co/7N7Uwakf0O

As the leaders of Europe’s three biggest economies appeared in Kyiv on Thursday to send a message of support to Ukraine, Russia cut flows to Europe’s most important natural gas pipeline for the second day in a row. https://t.co/ob5brCqg5g

Representative Bennie Thompson, chairman of the Jan. 6 committee, has spent his career fighting to protect the right to vote. He said the committee’s work was among the most important he had engaged in as a politician. https://t.co/l3qMiDjb9p https://t.co/6uVdJQaumJ
The New York Times analyzed court documents, texts and hundreds of videos to reveal how the Proud Boys instigated critical breaches of the Capitol on Jan. 6. https://t.co/0dg7ccCFCx
A Uvalde police officer had a chance to shoot the gunman before he entered the school but hesitated, fearing injuries to others, an official said. https://t.co/tFeXqGTBse

The Dutch intelligence service said it prevented a Russian spy from infiltrating the International Criminal Court. The spy built an identity as a Brazilian citizen that helped him get an internship at the court, which is investigating Russian war crimes. https://t.co/G4JSJ9sWew

Federico Carboni on Thursday became the first person in Italy to die by legal assisted suicide. Paralyzed 12 years ago in a traffic accident, he faced a series of legal, bureaucratic and financial hurdles in his pursuit of death. https://t.co/eyOgHXNL3j

The New York Times analyzed court documents, texts and hundreds of videos to reveal how the Proud Boys instigated critical breaches of the Capitol on Jan. 6. https://t.co/e6ywYf6wMs https://t.co/gZ85j1Ywjs

Representative Bennie Thompson, chairman of the Jan. 6 committee, has spent his career fighting to protect the right to vote. He said the committee’s work was among the most important he had engaged in as a politician. https://t.co/TDmXSU4tui

The father of a teenage girl filed a lawsuit against three police officers in Loveland, Colorado, who arrested her in 2020, saying they used excessive force when they slammed the 14-year-old onto concrete, fired a Taser at him and choked the family’s dog. https://t.co/DclcSEMa3R
Breaking News: Prime Minister Boris Johnson paid a second surprise visit to Kyiv with a new offer of training for the Ukrainian military. https://t.co/K2ZOmupStA

FIFA selected 16 host cities for the 2026 World Cup, which will sprawl across the U.S., Canada and Mexico.
See the full list here. https://t.co/37u7rWtvqy

President Vladimir Putin’s appearance at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum was delayed by “large-scale” cyberattacks on the conference’s computer systems, the Kremlin said. https://t.co/w61L2C0GOL

Donald Trump condemned Mike Pence even as he knew rioters were violently storming the Capitol while his vice president was inside, the House committee investigating Jan. 6 said.
Pence fled for his life, and at one point was just 40 feet away from the mob. https://t.co/H4oxgU3DpZ
Breaking News: Vince McMahon, the WWE executive, has stepped down while the company investigates allegations of misconduct against him. https://t.co/vDxY2k9cXL

SpaceX fired employees who helped write and distribute an open letter criticizing Elon Musk's public behavior and tweeting, said three employees with knowledge of the situation. https://t.co/IPVl2XIuBr

BTS has become not only a cultural sensation, but also a powerful stakeholder in South Korea's economy.
In just one day after the group announced it would be taking a break to focus on solo projects, the band's label, HYBE, saw its stock price plunge 28%. https://t.co/WAyHLCue8C https://t.co/yTTzDa6yh9

Revlon filed for bankruptcy this week. The cosmetics brand has struggled to attract younger shoppers who are choosing celebrity makeup lines like those by Kylie Jenner and Rihanna. https://t.co/HNp9DMAoIl

Mike Pence made it clear he's considering a 2024 presidential bid by traveling to early states and endorsing candidates opposed by Donald Trump. Pence told The New York Times he's heard gratitude from voters for refusing to bend to pressure. https://t.co/RE0GGvWphX
Breaking News: The European Commission recommended Ukraine for EU candidacy, the first formal step in a process that normally takes more than a decade. https://t.co/8hty3nKPUV

Golden State won the NBA championship after defeating the Boston Celtics, 103-90, on Thursday.
Stephen Curry was named the most valuable player of the finals. “Without him, none of this happens,” Golden State Coach Steve Kerr said. https://t.co/t6aAeWqiET https://t.co/Z6YmIU4rCx

For many of Johnny Depp’s fans, “the actor’s physical appeal offered an external manifestation of inner worth,” Rhonda Garelick writes. While Amber Heard’s beauty “was frequently held against her, offered as proof of her capacity to deceive.” https://t.co/OvWdEzlCVa

SpaceX fired employees who helped write and distribute an open letter criticizing Elon Musk's public behavior and tweeting, said three employees with knowledge of the situation. https://t.co/WWxZRuXEzj
Golden State won its fourth title in eight seasons, beating the Boston Celtics in Game 6 of the NBA finals. https://t.co/JDxwbTu3UR

A lawsuit filed last week by a South Florida synagogue challenges new legislation in the state banning most abortions after 15 weeks, saying it violates the State Constitution’s right to privacy and freedom of religion. https://t.co/KgwMUfVPPj

Students in Hong Kong will soon be given textbooks that say Hong Kong was never a British colony.
The books are part of China’s effort to instill a historical narrative in a city where a pro-democracy movement was crushed. https://t.co/Ubm7X1xmk3
